@june024 hey there is something I don't understand (I'm not familiar with RO so please forgive my ignorance) He keeps saying that she did this for his sake. So you guess that Tomoko's class is a Soul Linker, so my question is can a character get a skill from a different class and can you then share them??? because then the ending will make sense if she got the Assassins Soul skill for You/Kou and that is why she need to stick to the RK to farm for this skill. Thanks for you time

If you'll ask why didn't Tomoko ask for You/Kou for help instead, Kou/You is an Assassin class character.

Normally, Assassins are dodgers. Having the highest flee and dodge rate in-game. Makes sense to use him as a tanker right? Not really. As a flee or dodger, the more the monsters come to beat you, the lesser your flee gets effective as a defensive tool. Assassins are normally offensive characters than defensive and are normally called to become character killers (Yay! EDP for the win) or emperium breakers (EDP again).

However, leveling an Assassin is tough. It takes time and patience since they don't have the best damage output until they reach the later levels unlike RK's which are basically damage absorbers but can still wallop some damage against characters. 

They do kneel down later on to Assassins because well, in later stages, Sins deal more damage than RK's...

Now, if you'll ask why he mentioned that Tomoko got the skill for him in exchange for sleeping with the Rune Knight, allow me to indulge you to some RO knowhow...

Rune Knights or RK as we call them, are one of the sturdiest characters you can face. Enemies can go hit them and they'll just consider it as a poke to them. Having one of the highest defense in-game, it's no wonder other characters ask them to help them in leveling up. Normally they tank for the party or guild while the others keep beating the monsters to level up faster.

I'm not sure if the girl was a Soul Linker. As a Soul Linker, the character has the most supportive skill of all characters in-game. They have alot of awesome offensive skills but their main attribute is to "link" with other characters to boost their skills and efficiency.

In terms of the story, the skill "Assassin's Soul" or "Assassin Spirit" allows the Assassin class (Assassin, Assassin Cross and Guillotine Cross) to gain access to  his hidden skills. More importantly, it improves one of his dominant skill "Sonic Blow" which allows him to hit an enemy eight consecutive times. The improvement comes with the skill getting double damage plus it gets it's cool down halved.

@dizzy_jizzy well, ntr might give the opportunity for an interesting story but i honestly do not feel like it actually raises the probability of the story being good. there is so much opportunity to be taken by a creative mind or wasted by a less gifted one, regardless of the particular genre. its like saying having a rope increases the chance of suicide. sure, you can kill yourself with it, but you will only do it if you are really hellbent on doing it, and then you would have done it some way anyhow. if there is some property that is consistently associated with higher quality story, i would say it is the theme of aging. everything i can think of right now spanning multiple generations or even just following the development of one usually is moving. the story i liked most on the whole was https://nhentai.net/g/118855/ because it has a bit of everything with a healthy dose of self aware humor. concerning the other end of the spectrum, almost all hypnosis stuff is just incredibly bland
Ragnarok online sure has a lot of NTR
Thanky you kind stranger. Also yeah this is why i like ntr, way better than "everything's great" bullshit

it is nice how game mechanics can be used to tell such an engaging story. also if i am getting this right he moved on, found his way, and could even feel nostalgic bitter sweetness for his love long gone, which is an unusually wholesome ending to the tragic "for his sake"-ntr type
